forumNotes.author: mANZOCRICH
forumNotes.content: what I am trying is to boot nativeEx from a USB stick but when I instruct pe2usb.cmd to write it to my stick , it usually stop after "Please Wait" message with the error of 00000007B , my goal is to boot any minimal version of windows from stick so it doesnt take time to boot with USB 1.1 and also to support the wireless service . Please help me. Thanks in advance

forumNotes.author: amalux
forumNotes.content:
> what I am trying is to boot nativeEx from a USB stick but when I instruct pe2usb.cmd to write it to my stick , it usually stop after "Please Wait" message with the error of 00000007B , my goal is to boot any minimal version of windows from stick so it doesnt take time to boot with USB 1.1 and also to support the wireless service . Please help me. Thanks in advance
Hi mANZOCRICH, welcome ![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif)   

For the 00000007B error, use the modified ntdetect [here](http://www.msfn.org/board/index.php?showtopic=112630&pid=738009&mode=threaded&start=#entry738009 "External link") and explained in detail in tutorial [here](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=4111 "External link") under More Advanced Options section. The USB speed is determined by your hardware, as long as you use a 2.0 UFD/USB device and your host machine supports 2.0 you should be fine. Wireless is more complicated; focus on mastering the first two steps with NIC support and *wired* connectivity for now ![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif)

forumNotes.author: mANZOCRICH
forumNotes.content: Okay , I got LiveXP booting well from the USB stick now , thank you very much , I also got a HUWAUI modem device , it is 3g wireless modem I am using to connect to the Internet , the problem is I can't get it working under LiveXP , have anyone tryed to install a USB device under LiveXP , I tryed using the driver backup/restore method but it is not working ,The point is that I want to get a TP-LINK wireless USB stick but I am afraid to buy it and get it "useless" under the LiveXP. Manzo

forumNotes.author: Galapo
forumNotes.content:
Try the PEDialup script under 'Apps\\Net'.  

Regards,  
Galapo.

forumNotes.author: amalux
forumNotes.content:
> Okay , I got LiveXP booting well from the USB stick now , thank you very much , I also got a HUWAUI modem device , it is 3g wireless modem I am using to connect to the Internet , the problem is I can't get it working under LiveXP , have anyone tryed to install a USB device under LiveXP , I tryed using the driver backup/restore method but it is not working ,The point is that I want to get a TP-LINK wireless USB stick but I am afraid to buy it and get it "useless" under the LiveXP. Manzo
The TP-LINK is just an adapter so you won't want to install LiveXP on that ![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif) - wireless in LiveXP is experimental at best and I'm not sure it's even possible yet based on posts like [this one](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=6582 "External link"). You can read more about it [here](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=7036 "External link") and decide if it's something you want to try; just saw Galapo's post on PEDialup (get it [here](http://livexp.boot-land.net/ "External link")), looks interesting, I haven't tried it yet myself but let us know if you have success ![:poke:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/poke.gif)
